description: BioServices is a Python package that provides programmatic access to many Bioinformatics Web Services (e.g., UniProt, EUtils, ENA, UniChem, etc) and a framework to easily implement new Web Service wrappers (based on WSDL/SOAP or REST protocols).
name: Bioservices

metadata.abstract: Motivation: Web interfaces provide access to numerous biological databases. Many can be accessed to in a programmatic way thanks to Web Services. Building applications that combine several of them would benefit from a single framework. Results: BioServices is a comprehensive Python framework that provides programmatic access to major bioinformatics Web Services (e.g. KEGG, UniProt, BioModels, ChEMBLdb). Wrapping additional Web Services based either on Representational State Transfer or Simple Object Access Protocol/Web Services Description Language technologies is eased by the usage of object-oriented programming.
metadata.title: BioServices: A common Python package to access biological Web Services programmatically
